ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Presbycusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Bilateral symmetrical sloping sensorineural hearing loss in an 82-year-old with gradual progression. Poor speech recognition (phonemic regression) and recruitment are consistent with cochlear aging. Retrocochlear pathology ruled out by normal immittance, ABR, and tone decay.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine hearing thresholds and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities, checking for phonemic regression.
To evaluate middle ear function and rule out conductive pathology.
To assess the acoustic reflex arc and check for recruitment or retrocochlear signs.
To rule out retrocochlear pathology given the asymmetry in speech scores or general protocol.
To assess outer hair cell function.
To screen for retrocochlear pathology (auditory fatigue).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Results show a bilateral, symmetrical, sloping sensorineural hearing loss consistent with presbycusis. Speech recognition scores are disproportionately poor relative to pure-tone thresholds, indicating phonemic regression. Immittance, ABR, and tone-decay results are normal or negative for retrocochlear pathology, confirming a cochlear site of lesion.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral symmetrical sloping sensorineural hearing loss. Right thresholds slope from ~15 dB HL at 250 Hz to ~80 dB HL at 8000 Hz. Left thresholds slope from ~10 dB HL at 250 Hz to ~65 dB HL at 8000 Hz. No air-bone gaps.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT: Right 50 dB HL, Left 45 dB HL. SRS: Right 62%, Left 58%. Scores are poor to fair, suggesting phonemic regression.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A tympanograms bilaterally. Static compliance: Right 0.92 cc, Left 0.65 cc.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present. 1000 Hz Ipsi: 95 dB HL AU. 2000 Hz Contra: Right 90 dB HL, Left 100 dB HL.

tests.name: ABR
tests.result_summary: All waves normal at high sensation levels; interpeak latencies normal; latency-intensity function steep (consistent with recruitment).

tests.name: Tone-decay test
tests.result_summary: Right: 10 dB decay in 60 seconds. Left: 15 dB decay in 60 seconds. Negative for retrocochlear pathology.

proposed_items: Auditory rehabilitation program emphasizing coping strategies
Assistive listening devices (e.g., personal FM system, telephone amplifier)
counseling_actions: Speak directly to the patient during counseling, even if family is present
Advise family that hearing aids should be purchased on a trial basis given past negative experiences
Explain that success requires auditory rehabilitation and coping strategies, not just the device
Reassure the patient that hearing loss is unlikely to progress significantly (without making unethical guarantees)
Explain need for medical concurrence if required by state law

escalation.rationale_short: Patient requires audiologic rehabilitation and hearing aid trial for presbycusis. Medical clearance may be sought if required by law.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds and assess benefit from amplification and rehabilitation strategies.
